topic.title: Set Specific JVM Version on Mac OS X

section.title: Problem
section.p: How do I configure to run with the version X of the Apple Java virtual machine on my Mac OS X computer?

section.title: Solution
section.p: uses the first JVM from the list of preferred JVM versions set on your Mac computer that has a version number or higher. You can move your desired JVM version up in the preferred list by dragging it with the mouse on a higher position in the list of JVMs available in the Java Preferences panel that is opened from Applications Utilities Java Java Preferences .
